message: Sigh. My friends convinced me to run to the bakery for some snacks, and now I'm stuck in this dusty room doing extra tasks because I was late to class.

message: May the shadow assist you on your journey
The shadow speaks to us. It watches over our thoughts, and guides us.
To follow the shadow, one must listen to its voice and direct their gaze toward its wisdom.
Walk the path of one's destiny, and as the challenges upon your journey unfold, follow the guiding voice of the shadow.

Terrifying, humanoid creatures with blood-red scales instead of skin, and the head of a giant Erumen lizard.

Behind it, lies a story, child.
In the past, the people of Brightport used to worship the Shadow at the Great Water Temple.
But twenty years ago, calamity struck. A race of Erumen lizards, similar to us in form but beastly in nature, engulfed the islands of the lake.

The temple was ransacked, and not a single one of its acolytes or servants returned. Nowadays, we lament the loss and pray that one day the temple will be restored to its purpose in the worship of the Shadow.

i have heard stories from adventurer's of lizardmen with scales of different colors, displaying more reason than the red-scaled ones, but stay safe my child.

message: I once heard a story about a guy who visited a kingdom ruled by rats--they call it the Ratdom! Haha! People say he disappeared as a child and reappeared a decade later, wearing clothes made entirely of ratskin. He even spoke Rattish! Imagine that, speaking Rattish! Hic. speaking of rats....

Those folks from Brimhaven--I'd refrain from rudely calling them... hmm, maybe mice. But if anyone resembles a mouse, it would be them. We got a job offer from.. Hic. I’m professional enough not to reveal our clients! Long story short, we ended up declining due to a failure in negotiations. The client then went and hired some local, incompetent bunglers to handle the delicate job! Should’ve seen it coming, considering we wouldn’t budge on the price. Speaking of price...

replies.text: Interesting, but i must go now.

message: Speaking of "Never end" I was assigned to a job a while ago, up in the north. On my way there, I encountered a small critter. Eager for some fresh meat, I slew it, but what came next was, quite literally, never-ending! A whole group of large beasts were watching me, getting ready to skin my hunt. Once I was distracted enough, they came pouring out of the bushes. I could maybe count a hundred before I went running! I left the meat behind--and even dropped my heirloom skinning knife. Speaking of knives...
